context_meta.title: Sick dog's 'cancer' revealed to be chewed up teddy bears
context_meta.summary: The owners of a sick St. Bernard dog were left stunned when a mass which vets thought was cancer turned out to be four half-chewed teddy bears. Maisy, who bears similarities to loveable pooch Beethoven in the series of comedy films written by John Hughes, had the soft toys removed during an intricate procedure. The 8-year-old now has a “new lease of life” and is thriving at home, said her relieved owners who admit they feared the worst. They revealed how a CT scan showed Maisy had an unusually full stomach and a mass on her spleen – an issue which was initially put down to her food not being digested properly. This led her vet to diagnose possible cancer and the adorable dog was rushed in for

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: I lost legs and part of my face after a dog scratch
context_meta.summary: Dr Jaco Nel lost both his legs, all the fingers on one hand and suffered a facial disfigurement after he was scratched while playing with his dog. He told the Victoria Derbyshire programme he contracted sepsis caused by bacteria in cocker spaniel Harvey's saliva. Despite disinfecting the small scratch, Dr Nel was in a coma for several days and had to learn to walk again.

context_meta.title: Expect to pay more to keep your pet healthy in Kentucky
context_meta.summary: PADUCAH — You can soon expect to pay more money to keep your family pet healthy. Kentucky lawmakers recently passed a 6 percent sales tax on small animal veterinarian visits and care services. Gov. Matt Bevin vetoed House Bill 366 on April 9, but lawmakers overrode the decision. Now, local pet lovers are speaking out against the bill. Jackie Cunningham says owning a pet was a bit more affordable when her kids were growing up. “Back then it probably cost around $100-$150 per year, total,” she says. “Now it's astronomically higher than that. I'd say at least four times that.” It's a price Cunningham says she's willing to pay to keep her dog, Scooter, healthy. But now, with HB 366, that price is

context_meta.title: Meet Guy the beagle: Meghan Markle's rescue dog now enjoying royal life
context_meta.summary: A dog adopted from an Ontario rescue home has proved to be of royal pedigree after having been whisked off to the United Kingdom to live with owner Meghan Markle and Prince Harry. When Guy the beagle came to A Dog's Dream Rescue in Oakville, Ont., founder Dolores Doherty said she wanted to find him a good home, but when Markle adopted the pup in 2015, she never imagined he would eventually be living as a royal. "He must be so spoiled," Doherty said with a laugh. Doherty said she was unaware of Markle's celebrity status when they started corresponding about finding a furry friend to keep her pooch, Bogart, company while the actress was on set for the Toronto-shot legal drama "Suits." context_meta.title: Lachine dog owners get more waterfront part access
context_meta.summary: MONTRÉAL, April 18, 2018 /CNW Telbec/ - Dogs owners will now be able to enjoy the waterfront parc along Lac St-Louis all year long from 34th avenue all the way to the most west borough limit. This change was adopted by the borough council in Lachine on February 12th. ''We are pleased to be able to ease our regulations and confident that simpler rules encourage greater compliance." says Lachine mayor Maja Vodanovic. Remember that, in general, dogs are prohibited in all parks, playgrounds and public places in the borough of Lachine, except at the following locations: promenade du Rail, between 6th ave and 29th ave, from 6am to 11pm park at 55th avenue, corner of autoroute 20 between 6am and 11pm

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Child needs 48 stitches after dog bite to the face in Stirling
context_meta.summary: A three-year-old girl was bitten in the face by a dog in Stirling, Ont., Central Hatstings OPP say. On April 1, OPP were called to a home to investigate a child who was bitten by a dog. According to police, the girl and her mother were in a common area of an apartment building when a dog entered the area and bit the child. The girl was transported to the hospital where she received 48 stitches to her face. Police say the dog belonged to a person visiting the building. The incident is being investigated under the Dog Owner's Liability Act. OPP released information about the incident Thursday but were not available for comment. There is no word yet on what will happen to the dog.

context_meta.title: 16 Dogs Recovered From Anne Arundel Co. Home; 1 Reported Missing
context_meta.summary: BALTIMORE (WJZ)– Animal control removed 16 dogs from an Anne Arundel County residence last Friday after an investigation was launched concerning the condition of the animals. Animal control officials responded to a home on Sarah Avenue in Linthicum where they removed 16 dogs that were living in substandard conditions, according to investigators. It was also discovered that one of the dogs recovered, was reported missing in May of 2017 and has been reunited with its family after a microchip was discovered on the dog. Authorities are in the process of verifying ownership for 11 of the dogs recovered. To ensure that the dogs aren't missing, photos of the dogs have been released. Most of these dogs

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: A veteran with PTSD fell on hard times. Then his service dog was taken away from him.
context_meta.summary: An Air Force veteran says he had his service dog taken away and given to another family. Now, he doesn't know where his dog is or if she is OK and has filed lawsuits to try to get her back. Noah Malakan, 36, served in the Air Force for eight years until he was honorably discharged in 2012. But ever since, he has struggled with post-traumatic stress disorder. That's why Malakan and his wife, Mary, decided to adopt a bulldog named "Betty Boop" from Nate's Honor Animal Rescue in January. From the moment he saw the dog, Malakan said, he knew that she was supposed to be with him and his family. He said Betty Boop brought him comfort almost instantly and followed him around everywhere. context_meta.title: The 15 most dangerous human foods for dogs
context_meta.summary: In 2017, the ASPCA Animal Poison Control Center received 199,000 poisoning cases, almost one-fifth of which were the result of ingesting human foods. As strange as it might seem, everyday human foods are the most common cause of pet poisoning cases apart from prescription and over-the-counter medications. Researchers at NomNomNow, a pet company that creates healthy and fresh dog food, compiled the following list of human foods to avoid giving your dog. context_meta.title: Sunday's 'nauseating' dog attack in Dallas triggers far better response than we heard after 2016 death
context_meta.summary: In the 18 months since City Hall got serious about the plague of loose mutts,  bites are measurably down — although never down enough —  and dog catchers are picking up far more animals and writing more tickets. But animal services director Ed Jamison knows his operation needs a better footprint in South Dallas and areas to the southeast. Even prior to this week's attack, he was working with his bosses to increase field officers' presence in these neighborhoods, where calls for help were ignored for many years. Jamison also is pushing ideas at City Hall that would increase penalties in dog attacks. While police sometimes make charges stick, Jamison wants an ordinance that would lead to more owners

context_meta.title: Tips for running with your dog
context_meta.summary: Katrina Mealey runs at least 1 mile regularly with her 13-year-old Jack Russell terrier. While training for marathons, she brings her older dog home and immediately goes back out on the trail with her young German Shorthaired Pointer to run another 4 to 8 miles. Such steps simply keep her pets' health in mind as much as her own, said the College of Veterinary Medicine professor at Washington State University in Pullman. She's also chair of Small Animal Medicine and Research at the college. "With science, we don't know if dogs get the euphoria or the runner's high," Mealey said. context_meta.title: I Love Dogs, But The City Needs To Be Clean
context_meta.summary: Antwerp is one of the famous cities in Belgium, not only because The Port of Antwerp is one of the busiest port in the world, with over 150,000 people daily handling operations, but it used to be one of the dirtiest cities, with dogs waste at every corner, pavements and sometimes in front of shops. Be careful when walking in Antwerp a decade ago, trust me, you will surely come home with a stinking unfriendly guest. There are more major changes in the administration of the present Mayor Of Antwerp, the NV-A party leader Bart De Wever, that makes the city more enjoyable.

context_meta.title: Big boy Bumble gets second chance in Lakewood: Send us your pet rescue stories
context_meta.summary: LAKEWOOD, Ohio -- Bumble was with his littermates in Arkansas when I found him on Petfinder. My other adopted dog had passed away from lymphoma, and I had to save another one.  When I first inquired, Bumble was already spoken for. I told this particular agency that if whoever had adopted him decided they didn't want him later -- as he was going to be a very large dog -- to give me a call. Well, I received that call three weeks later.  Bumble had made it to Albany, N.Y., and they didn't want him. I didn't even care why not. And I didn't care how much it would cost to get him to Cleveland (I drove to Indiana for the last one). context_meta.title: Huntsville Animal Services tackles growing number of owner surrenders
context_meta.summary: HUNTSVILLE, AL (WAFF) - It's a packed house over at Huntsville Animal Services. Too many surrendered pets are coming in and not enough rescued pets are going out. "Our capacity is only for so many animals, and once we hit that it's very, very difficult,” Karen Buchan with Huntsville Animal Services said. In 2017, more than 700 pets were surrendered to Animal Services. That's a number down by 150 from 2016, and 350 fewer than in 2015. Owners who are led to surrender their dogs do so for many different reason, but Buchan says the Animal Shelter should always be the last resort. They advise owners to meet with them first and they will try to find a solution outside of surrender. "All you have to

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Fallen K-9 officer's dog may be released from hospital soon
context_meta.summary: Yarmouth police Sergeant Sean Gannon's K-9 partner may be released from the hospital soon. Nero has been under the care of veterinarians at Cape Cod Veterinary Specialists in Buzzards Bay while he recovers from a gunshot wound. It's possible that he could be discharged “in the next day or so,” according to Peter McClelland, a retired Yarmouth K-9 officer who has remained a constant presence at the dog's side. Gannon's funeral was held Wednesday at St. Pius X Church in Yarmouth. McClelland said it's possible that Nero could make a complete recovery and eventually be able to return to work a police dog. It's also possible that he could take an early retirement. Ultimately, the decision will be

context_meta.title: Army vet tells Megyn Kelly how her service dog has changed her life
context_meta.summary: Former Army Command Sgt.-Maj. Gretchen Evans visits Megyn Kelly TODAY along with her service dog, Aura, to talk about America's VetDogs. Evans, who is deaf due to a service-related injury, explains how Aura helps her live a full life: “She's not only changed my life, she's saved my life.”

context_meta.title: Atlanta United 2 players to help Gwinnett students in garden cleanup
context_meta.summary: Two Atlanta United 2 players will visit a Norcross elementary school to help students with a garden cleanup. READ | Gwinnett city using goats to manage vegetation in park Jon Gallagher and Paul Christensen will visit Graves Elementary School on Thursday, April 19. They will partner with students in a cleanup of the school's learning garden as a part of Major League Soccer's Greener Goals Week of Service. The week, in its third year, is in recognition of Earth Day and involves players across the league. context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Coping with the loss of a pet
context_meta.summary: Reports in the media say the Queen has been left "heartbroken" by the loss of her corgi Willow, who famously appeared in a film with Daniel Craig's James Bond during the London Olympics' opening ceremony. Pets are members of the family, and it can feel like a huge loss when they pass away. So how can you cope if this happens, and what support is out there if you need a little help doing so? Alessandra had to explain to her son Ethan, who has autism, that his support dog Cocoa had died suddenly from eating sweets at a family friend's house. "It tore our life apart," says Alessandra. Cocoa had helped Ethan learn to walk, to go outside in busy London, and to cope with separation from his mum. And
